segments.text: How can she just stand there polishing that plate while the sink overflows?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water's everywhere, ruining the floor and cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's oblivious, with her foot soaked in the puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids, sneaking cookies like it's no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is on that ridiculous stool, about to crash any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're breaking all the rules, and she doesn't even glance their way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is wide open, cookies probably spilling out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just egging him on, reaching for her treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden looks perfect, but inside it's a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe no one's noticing this chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to turn off that faucet before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kind of negligence drives me up the wall.
segments.speaker: PAR
